casebody.data:
FLORENCE C. JOHNSON, v. WYETH PENNINGTON JOHNSON [No. 72,

October Term, 1937.]

*693 Decided January 12th, 1938.

The cause was argued before Bond, C. J., Urner, Offutt, Parke, Sloan, Mitchell, Shehan, and Johnson, JJ.

Milton Leven, for the appellant. Henry L. D. Stanford, Jr., with whom were Samuel Campanaro and George W. Cameron on the brief, for the appellee. Shehan, J.,

delivered the opinion of the Court.
